newsitem.title: UK: BT shares gain after SocGen repeats buy.
newsitem.headline: BT shares gain after SocGen repeats buy.

text.p: Shares in British Telecommunications Plc (BT) were higher on Monday after analysts at SocGen repeated a buy recommendation.
BT shares were up 7-1/2 pence by 1132 GMT at 437, fractionally below a high of 438 pence.
"The company is undervalued at the moment...we are expecting significant outperformance," said Andrew Moffat of SocGen.
Moffat said he felt BT was undervalued compared with other recent flotations in the telecommunications sector and praised its planned merger with U.S. company MCI Communications Corp .
He said the stock could target 460-470 pence in the short-term but on some valuations would not be surprised to see shares reach 500 pence from now to two or three months after the merger.
"BT is going to be the first global phone company...MCI is the best U.S. phone company to be involved with," he said.
BT shareholders will vote on the proposed merger at an extraordinary general meeting on April 15.
Moffat said he felt BT could beat competitors to gain contracts as Concert, the international communications business owned by BT and MCI, targeted top companies for deals.
Analysts said there were also rumours another partner might be found for Concert in the next couple of months.
